column4: ok, so your computer does recognize that your iphone is there
and I guess you can probably look at the files, etc?
yes it does, even when i go my computer it shows new device named Iphone and there is all my pics but i cant manage media files etc...
now, are you able to pull files from your iphone?
i don't use itunes, but it's my understanding that you can't download files from the iphone?
don't you need to, umm, wipe it and sync the files fresh when you go to a new computer?
there is only pics nothing else, but ya i can copy them to computer, but cant do opposite i mean im not able to manage media files
(like if you used itunes on a different computer)
don't you, like, need to load in your media library and stuff?
ya and thats what im trying to do )
ah, ok
so, do you have the media files on your computer or something?
i don't know if you can download files from an iphone to your computer - isn't that a hardware limitation (and you run into the same problem with iTunes) ?
maybe i need an app for recognition USB port?
the USB port is ok if you can browse the pictures.
thenn have no idea whats the issue :(
http://www.linuxquestions.org/questions/linux-newbie-8/alternative-to-itunes-to-connect-iphone-to-ubuntu-11-04-a-887116/
make sure you have the package "libimobiledevice" and "libmobiledevice-utils" installed
that might convince it to work?
u r so kind:) let me read it but i believe i don't have any of them (of course it they dont come with this operation system automatically)
those two packages I listed should be something you can get from Synaptic
